poem:
"An Inescapable Chessboard of Duty"

Upon this world stage we each find a part,
A diplomat hands splashed with ink of the heart.
In halls of power, through whispers and shouts,
Truth weaves a path through forests of doubt.
The chessboard is set, pieces keep their guise,
Unmasking shadows beneath UNRWA's eyes,
Seeking peace in a story that never lies.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
